activities.name: SP_MasterJobEnd_Success
activities.description: This stored procedure receives the MasterProcessNumber as input and updates the status of the MasterJob table after successful execution of previous steps.

activities.name: SP_MasterJobEnd_Failure_Pipeline

activities.name: Lookup_KeyValueConfig
activities.description:
This LookUp calls a stored procedure which
pulls the key/value pairs

source.sqlReaderQuery:
SELECT dbo.udf_GetETLConfiguration('WebHookFull') AS WebHookFull,
	   dbo.udf_GetETLConfiguration('WebHookIncremental') AS WebHookIncremental,
	   dbo.udf_GetETLConfiguration('AnalysisServicesServer') AS AnalysisServicesServer,
	   dbo.udf_GetETLConfiguration('AzureSQLServerName') AS AzureSQLServerName,
	   dbo.udf_GetETLConfiguration('AzureSQLDatabaseName') AS AzureSQLDatabaseName,
	   dbo.udf_GetETLConfiguration('SubscriptionID') AS SubscriptionID,
	   dbo.udf_GetETLConfiguration('ResourceGroupName') AS ResourceGroupName,
           dbo.udf_GetETLConfiguration('SQLComputeSizeHigh') AS SQLComputeSizeHigh,
	   dbo.udf_GetETLConfiguration('SQLComputeSizeLow') AS SQLComputeSizeLow

activities.name: LookUp_JobConfigurationMetadataList
activities.description: This LookUp calls a stored procedure and returns the metadata for the DB2 tables that need to be copied to Azure Data Lake

activities.name: ForEach_CopyStagingRaw
activities.description: This ForEach loops through the metadata list and copies data nto Staging and Raw in Azure Data Lake.

activities.name: Copy_ADLStaging_ADLRaw
activities.description: This activity copies data from the ADL Staging location into a Raw storage folder. File path and name are dynamically derived from the Metadata lookup.

activities.name: LookUp_JobTableLogStart
activities.description: This LookUp calls a stored procedure which updates the status in the JobTableLog for each table being copied and returns JobTableLogID.

activities.name: SP_JobTableLogEnd_Success
activities.description: This stored procedure updates the JobTableLog status after successful execution of previous steps.

activities.name: SP_JobTableLogEnd_Failure3
activities.description: This stored procedures updates the status of the JobTableLog failed execution of previous steps.

activities.name: SP_JobTableLogEnd_Failure2
activities.description: This stored procedures updates the status of the JobTableLog failed execution of previous steps.

activities.name: Copy_Source_ADLStaging_Source1
activities.description: A query returns applicable data for each from Source which is then copied into Azure Data Lake in a staging folder. File path and name are dynamically derived from the Metadata lookup.

activities.name: SP_JobTableLogUpdate_Source1
activities.description: This stored procedure updates the JobTableLog with the SQL statement used and the number of rows read after successful execution of the copy from DB2 to staging

defaultActivities.name: Copy_Source_ADLStaging_Default
defaultActivities.description: A query returns applicable data for each from Source which is then copied into Azure Data Lake in a staging folder. File path and name are dynamically derived from the Metadata lookup.

defaultActivities.name: SP_JobTableLogUpdate_Default
defaultActivities.description: This stored procedure updates the JobTableLog with the SQL statement used and the number of rows read after successful execution of the copy from DB2 to staging

activities.name: LookUp_SelectSql
activities.description: Using a stored procedure, outputs correct SQL to use

activities.name: SP_MetadataListUpdate
activities.description: This stored procedure updates the JobTableLog status after successful execution of previous steps.

activities.name: SP_JobTableLogEnd_Failure5
activities.description: This stored procedures updates the status of the JobTableLog failed execution of previous steps.

activities.name: SP_JobTableLogEnd_Failure4
activities.description: This stored procedures updates the status of the JobTableLog failed execution of previous steps.

ifTrueActivities.name: Delete_ExistingStaging
ifTrueActivities.description: This activity deletes all existing files in the destination staging folder for each file being copied.

ifTrueActivities.name: Delete_ExistingRaw
ifTrueActivities.description: This activity deletes files that have the same start time as the current run (i.e. only when this is a rerun). Therefore, most of the time this activity will not delete any files and will fail. The pipeline will continue upon completion of this activity - not success.

activities.name: SP_JobTableLogEnd_Failure6
activities.description: This stored procedures updates the status of the JobTableLog failed execution of previous steps.

activities.description: This stored procedures updates the status of the JobTableLog failed execution of previous steps.

activities.description: This stored procedures updates the status of the JobTableLog failed execution of previous steps.

activities.description: This stored procedures updates the status of the JobTableLog failed execution of previous steps.

activities.name: SP_JobTableLogEnd_Failure10
activities.description: This stored procedures updates the status of the JobTableLog failed execution of previous steps.

activities.description: This stored procedure receives the MasterProcessNumber as input and updates the status of the MasterJob table after failed execution of previous steps.

properties.description: This pipeline is used to copy data from DB2 to Azure Data Lake for both Staging and Raw storage. Several stored procedures are called to update logging and return metadata for the data that needs to be copied.

activities.name: LookUp_MasterJobStart
activities.description: This LookUp calls a stored procedure which creates the ETL.JobMaster status row and returns the MasterProcessNumber

ifTrueActivities.description: This stored procedure receives the MasterProcessNumber as input and updates the status of the MasterJob table after failed execution of previous steps.

properties.description: connect to ADLS Gen 2 via key vault using storage key secret
This is a linked service to our Key Vault service
Self hosted IR running on Gateway01
An example mapping data flow to load dim_customer

typeProperties.script:
parameters{
	JobNumber as integer (1)
}
source(output(
		CustomerID as integer,
		NameStyle as boolean,
		Title as string,
		FirstName as string,
		MiddleName as string,
		LastName as string,
		Suffix as string,
		CompanyName as string,
		SalesPerson as string,
		EmailAddress as string,
		Phone as string,
		PasswordHash as string,
		PasswordSalt as string,
		rowguid as string,
		ModifiedDate as timestamp
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	inferDriftedColumnTypes: true,
	format: 'parquet') ~> srcCustomer
source(output(
		CustomerID as integer,
		AddressID as integer,
		AddressType as string,
		rowguid as string,
		ModifiedDate as timestamp
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	inferDriftedColumnTypes: true,
	format: 'parquet') ~> srcCustomerAddress
source(output(
		AddressID as integer,
		AddressLine1 as string,
		AddressLine2 as string,
		City as string,
		StateProvince as string,
		CountryRegion as string,
		PostalCode as string,
		rowguid as string,
		ModifiedDate as timestamp
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	format: 'parquet') ~> srcAddress
srcCustomer, srcCustomerAddress lookup(srcCustomer@CustomerID == srcCustomerAddress@CustomerID,
	multiple: false,
	pickup: 'first',
	asc(AddressID, true),
	asc(AddressType, true),
	broadcast: 'auto')~> LookupCustomerAddress
LookupCustomerAddress select(mapColumn(
		CustomerID = srcCustomer@CustomerID,
		NameStyle,
		Title,
		FirstName,
		MiddleName,
		LastName,
		Suffix,
		CompanyName,
		SalesPerson,
		EmailAddress,
		Phone,
		PasswordHash,
		PasswordSalt,
		ModifiedDate = srcCustomer@ModifiedDate,
		AddressID,
		AddressType
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> SelectCustomerAddress
SelectCustomerAddress, srcAddress lookup(SelectCustomerAddress@AddressID == srcAddress@AddressID,
	multiple: false,
	pickup: 'any',
	broadcast: 'auto')~> LookupAddress
LookupAddress select(mapColumn(
		CustomerID,
		NameStyle,
		Title,
		FirstName,
		MiddleName,
		LastName,
		Suffix,
		CompanyName,
		SalesPerson,
		EmailAddress,
		Phone,
		PasswordHash,
		PasswordSalt,
		ModifiedDate = SelectCustomerAddress@ModifiedDate,
		AddressID = SelectCustomerAddress@AddressID,
		AddressType,
		AddressLine1,
		AddressLine2,
		City,
		StateProvince,
		CountryRegion,
		PostalCode
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> SelectAddress
SelectAddress derive(FullName = trim(concat(iifNull(FirstName,""), " ", iifNull(MiddleName,""), " ", iifNull(LastName,""), " ", iifNull(Suffix,"")
)
),
		each(match(type=="string"), $$ = iifNull(trim($$), ""))) ~> DerivedCustomerColumns
DerivedCustomerColumns alterRow(upsertIf(true())) ~> AlterRow
AlterRow sink(input(
		Customer_sk as integer,
		CustomerID as integer,
		NameStyle as boolean,
		Title as string,
		FirstName as string,
		MiddleName as string,
		LastName as string,
		Suffix as string,
		FullName as string,
		CompanyName as string,
		SalesPerson as string,
		EmailAddress as string,
		Phone as string,
		PasswordHash as string,
		PasswordSalt as string,
		ModifiedDate as timestamp,
		AddressID as integer,
		AddressType as string,
		AddressLine1 as string,
		AddressLine2 as string,
		City as string,
		StateProvince as string,
		CountryRegion as string,
		PostalCode as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	deletable:false,
	insertable:false,
	updateable:false,
	upsertable:true,
	keys:['CustomerID'],
	format: 'table',
	mapColumn(
		CustomerID,
		NameStyle,
		Title,
		FirstName,
		MiddleName,
		LastName,
		Suffix,
		FullName,
		CompanyName,
		SalesPerson,
		EmailAddress,
		Phone,
		PasswordHash,
		PasswordSalt,
		ModifiedDate,
		AddressID,
		AddressType,
		AddressLine1,
		AddressLine2,
		City,
		StateProvince,
		CountryRegion,
		PostalCode
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> SinkDimCustomer
